title: Chelsea vs Man Utd TV channel, live stream, time, odds, team news and head-to-head
text:
Frank Lampard wants to keep up Chelsea’s fine winning run (Picture: Getty Images)

Chelsea host Manchester United in the fourth round of the EFL Cup on Wednesday night, with both teams looking to keep up winning runs.

The Blues have won seven on the spin in all competitions, while the Red Devils have picked up back-to-back wins after a decent draw against Liverpool in the Premier League.

The two sides met on the opening day of the league season with United winning 4-0 at Old Trafford, although Ole Gunnar Solskjaer admitted that result flattered his side.

What time is Chelsea vs Man Utd?

The match kicks-off at 8.05pm on Wednesday 30 October at Stamford Bridge.

What time is Chelsea vs Man Utd on and is there a live stream?

Sky Sports Main Event will be showing the game live with coverage starting at 7pm.

Subscribers will be able to stream the action on Sky Go or on the Sky Sports app.

Chelsea vs Man Utd odds

Chelsea 1.95 (20/21)

Draw 3.8 (14/5)

Man Utd 4.3 (100/30)

Odds courtesy of Betfair Exchange

Team news

Antonio Rudiger, Andreas Christensen, Ross Barkley, N’Golo Kante and Ruben Loftus-Cheek are all still out for Chelsea.

Olivier Giroud and Michy Batshuayi are pushing for starts.

Paul Pogba, Axel Tuanzebe, Luke Shaw, Nemanja Matic, Diogo Dalot, Eric Bailly and Timothy Fosu-Mensah are all out through injury for United, while David de Gea has not traveled.

Brandon Williams and James Garner are expected to make appearances.

Head-to-head in last five meetings 11 Aug 2019 – Man Utd 4-0 Chelsea – Premier League

28 Apr 2019 – Man Utd 1-1 Chelsea – Premier League

18 Feb 2019 – Chelsea 0-2 Man Utd – FA Cup

20 Oct 2018 – Chelsea 2-2 Man Utd – Premier League

19 May 2018 – Chelsea 1-0 Man Utd – FA Cup

MORE: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer admits Man Utd were flattered by 4-0 win over Chelsea on Premier League opening day
